com.shopify.buy.dataprovider

Class BuyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shopify.buy.dataprovider.BuyClient

  • public class BuyClient
extends Object
    The BuyClient provides all requests needed to perform request on the Shopify Checkout API. Use this class to perform tasks such as getting a shop, getting collections and products for a shop, creating a Checkout on Shopify and completing Checkouts. All API methods presented here run asynchronously and return results via callback on the Main thread.

      • setPageSize

        public void setPageSize(int pageSize)
        Sets the page size used for paged API queries
        Parameters:
        pageSize - the number of Product to include in a page. The maximum page size is MAX_PAGE_SIZE and the minimum page size is MIN_PAGE_SIZE. If the page size is less than MIN_PAGE_SIZE, it will be set to MIN_PAGE_SIZE. If the page size is greater than MAX_PAGE_SIZE it will be set to MAX_PAGE_SIZE. The default value is DEFAULT_PAGE_SIZE

        Parameters:
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

                        String collectionId,

        Parameters:
        page - the 1-based page index. The page size can be set with setPageSize(int)
        collectionId - the collectionId that we want to fetch products for
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

      • completeCheckout

        public void completeCheckout(Checkout checkout,
                             retrofit.Callback<Checkout> callback)
        Complete the checkout and process the payment session
        Parameters:
        checkout - a Checkout that has had a CreditCard associated with it using storeCreditCard(CreditCard, Checkout, Callback)
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

      • getCheckoutCompletionStatus

        public void getCheckoutCompletionStatus(Checkout checkout,
                                        retrofit.Callback<Boolean> callback)
        Get the status of the payment session associated with checkout. callback will be called with a boolean value indicating whether the session has completed or not. This method should be polled until the callback response is true
        Parameters:
        checkout - a Checkout that has been passed as a parameter to completeCheckout(Checkout, Callback)
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

                          Checkout checkout,
                          retrofit.Callback<Checkout> callback)
        Apply a gift card to a Checkout
        Parameters:
        giftCardCode - the gift card code for a gift card associated with the current Shop
        checkout - the Checkout object to apply the gift card to
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

      • removeGiftCard

        public void removeGiftCard(GiftCard giftCard,
                           Checkout checkout,
                           retrofit.Callback<Checkout> callback)
        Remove a gift card that was previously applied to a Checkout
        Parameters:
        giftCard - the GiftCard to remove from the Checkout
        checkout - the Checkout to remove the GiftCard from
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

      • removeProductReservationsFromCheckout

        public void removeProductReservationsFromCheckout(Checkout checkout,
                                                  retrofit.Callback<Checkout> callback)
        Convenience method to release all product inventory reservations by setting the `reservationTime` of the checkout `0` and calling updateCheckout(Checkout, Callback). We recommend creating a new `Checkout` object from a `Cart` for further API calls.
        Parameters:
        checkout - the Checkout to expire
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null

      • testIntegration

        public void testIntegration(retrofit.Callback<Void> callback)
        Test the integration with your shop. This should not be shipped in production code
        Parameters:
        callback - the Callback that will be used to indicate the response from the asynchronous network operation, not null
